Posts.Content: Oct 28, 2009 05:23PM TXGrama wrote: 47 and premenopausal.  I found my tumor and had a negative mammo  less than a year earlier (mammos weren't as good 19 years ago). 6 mos of chemo as I was high risk of recurrence as ER-PR- (no HER2 at that time).
Posts.Title: Poll - How old were you when dx with BC Times3 Minetta57

Posts.Content: Oct 27, 2009 11:23PM TXGrama wrote: I'm also from central Texas, but you might try and contact the local office of the American Cancer Society.  That is how I found a support group when I was diagnosed 19 years ago (lived in CA).  I know a support group helped me when first diagnosed as the only person I had known with breast cancer had died of it.  In those days, there wasn't the web/internet.  Some smaller towns (where I live now) have a support group, but not specifically for breast cancer. The ACS office that serves Sherman area is in Dallas - (214) 819-1200 (from ACS website).  Maybe there is a group in Denton. Hugs Shirley
Posts.Title: Anyone here from North Texas? Sherri_V TXGrama
